description: Lenart Kova quietly patches BCI network priorities, ensuring restored citizens retain full privileges while system routines deprioritize others. He suppresses evidence of the restoration scheme to internal contacts, prioritizing order over transparency.

A critical flaw emerges in BCI-dependent transit and utilities: only restored citizens' credentials allow unrestricted access. Directorate techs are notified but are unable to bypass Lenart's settings without risking total BCI collapse.
After a maintenance update, system functionality appears fully restored only for households tied to restored identities. Neighborhoods notice these individuals easily resolve issues others cannot.

Citywide transport sees rolling outages, with commuters stranded for hours. Frustration and rumors of elite favoritism spread as only restored citizens travel unhindered and begin coordinating ad-hoc aid responses.

Power disruptions hit several districts but spare blocks where restored citizens reside. Ordinary residents increasingly turn to restored neighbors for help, as Council factions remain paralyzed by internal dispute and systems grow more divided.
